title.narrative: STRENGHTENED DISTRICT CAPACITY FOR WASHSERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: Four district development authorities have strengthened capacity to deliver equitable, adequate, sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at households, schools and health facilities, including during emergencies, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Supply And Logistics, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

sector.narrative: Field Monitoring including humanitarian performance monitoring
Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Four district development authorities have strengthened capacity to deliver equitable, adequate, sustainable WASH services athouseholds, schools and health facilities, including during emergencies

description.narrative: This year, 37,225 students, including 17,781 girls, now have clean water, gender-segregated toilets, and handwashing facilities in 116 schools in four UNICEF focus districts. Four UNICEF focus districts have functional WASH committees effectively extending and monitoring WASH services delivery. UNICEF strengthened sanitation supply chains by introducing SATO pans and promoting safe sanitation technologies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
